multiplayermenu.hostserverdescription:
You can host a server by opening the following file through a file explorer:
Go to the game properties in steam and click 'browse local files'. Open 'colonyserver.exe' to host a server.

languagemenu.wiptext: Work in progress. This does not cover all text in the game, and some translations may cover less than others.
languagemenu.coverage: This locale is {0:F1}% complete. To help localize this, see the forums or our repository on github

banner.description: Colonists require 5 food units per day, and a bed. Recruiting a colonist costs 50 food units.
banner.resettooltipb: This kills all your colonists and removes your job fields.
banner.resettooltipc: It also gives you a fresh new inventory and stockpile.

specialblockremoval.description: Removing this block of type {0} may cause problems for a colony. What do you want to do?

tooljob.description: Select the type of area you want to create.
tooljob.minerc: Place on bottom layer of the world
tooljob.berrya: Quick and easy food, start with this!

toolconstruction.description: Select the type of area you want to create.

areaselection.description: Choose whether or not you want to remove the area here.

inventory.stockpiledescription: You can only craft things with the items in the slots on the bottom. Colonists can only use items in your stockpile.

limits.description: Colonists will work until the set amount is reached in the stockpile.

quickstart.closehelp: Press F1 to close or re-open this menu

page1.text1: The banner is the center of your colony. Press "2" to plant it. Right-click the banner to recruit colonists.
page1.text2: You need food and beds to recruit colonists. Colonists need to eat to survive. Make sure there is enough food available, or they will starve!
page1.text3: Press "I" to craft a bed. You can only craft things with the items in the slots on the bottom. Colonists can only use items in your stockpile. They access the stockpile using crates.
page1.text4: Monsters will attack your colony at night! Use quivers to place archers. Press 'R' to rotate them. Press 'G' to activate a lamp.

page2.description: You'll need food to recruit and sustain your colonists!
page2.text1: Use the Commandtool (press 1) to create a berry farmer. Right-click on a block of grass, choose the right job and create an area for the farmer. Left-click to change job type.
page2.text2: Producing bread is a complicated but efficient method of food production. Start by making a wheat farm. After two nights your wheat will be fully grown and your farmers will harvest it.
page2.text3: After that, youâ€™ll need to recruit two new people by placing a grindstone and an oven. The grindstone is used to convert the wheat into flour. A baker will use the oven to bake bread.

page3.description: Defend your colony against the monsters of the night!
page3.text1: At night, monsters will try to attack your colony. Place guards, build walls and dig moats to defend your colony. Monsters cannot climb two blocks.
page3.text2: Do not completely isolate your colony! If there is no path towards your banner, 'Siege Mode' will activate. During Siege Mode, your stored food is quickly consumed.
page3.text3: The amount of monsters increases when the amount of colonists grows! Make sure your guards have enough arrows.

page4.description: Without arrows, monsters will slaughter your colonists!
page4.text1: The deepest layer of the world contains infinite ores. Right-click those ores with the Commandtool to set miners to work. Don't forget to place a crate nearby.
page4.text2: Place a furnace. If there is an unemployed colonist, he will automatically go to the furnace and start crafting iron ore into iron bars.
page4.text3: Place a workbench to turn a colonist into a crafter. He will automatically make arrows and other items for you.

healthregensize1.name: Regeneration Increase I
healthregensize1.description: Increases regenerated amount of HP from 30 to 50

healthregensize2.name: Regeneration Increase II
healthregensize2.description: Increases regenerated amount of HP from 50 to 65

healthregensize3.name: Regeneration Increase III
healthregensize3.description: Increases regenerated amount of HP from 65 to 85

healthregensize4.name: Regeneration Increase IV
healthregensize4.description: Increases regenerated amount of HP from 85 to 100

healthregenspeed1.name: Regeneration Speed I
healthregenspeed1.description: Increases regeneration speed from 0.5 HP/s to 1 HP/s

healthregenspeed2.name: Regeneration Speed II
healthregenspeed2.description: Increases regeneration speed from 1 HP/s to 2 HP/s

healthregenspeed3.name: Regeneration Speed III
healthregenspeed3.description: Increases regeneration speed from 2 HP/s to 3 HP/s

healthregenspeed4.name: Regeneration Speed IV
healthregenspeed4.description: Increases regeneration speed from 3 HP/s to 4 HP/s

bloomery.name: Bloomery
bloomery.description: Unlock the Bloomery, which can process iron ore & galena ore

bronzeanvil.name: Bronze Anvil
bronzeanvil.description: Unlock the Bronze Anvil, which can process bronze

crossbow.name: Crossbow
crossbow.description: Unlocks the Crossbow, a more powerful weapon than the bow

fineryforge.name: Finery Forge
fineryforge.description: Unlocks the Finery Forge, which can create steel from iron

gunsmithshop.name: Gunsmith Shop
gunsmithshop.description: Unlocks the Gunsmith, who processes gunpowder and creates guns

matchlockgun.name: Matchlock Gun
matchlockgun.description: Unlocks the Matchlock Gun, an early type of gun

sciencebagadvanced.name: Advanced Science Bag
sciencebagadvanced.description: Unlocks the Advanced Science Bag, used for advanced research

sciencebagbasic.name: Basic Science Bag
sciencebagbasic.description: Unlocks the Basic Science Bag, used for basic research

sciencebagcolony.name: Colony Science Bag
sciencebagcolony.description: Unlocks the Colony Science Bag, used for colony related research

sciencebaglife.name: Life Science Bag
sciencebaglife.description: Unlocks the Life Science Bag, necessary to research health related upgrades

sciencebagmilitary.name: Military science bag
sciencebagmilitary.description: Unlocks the Military Science Bag, used for military research

tailorshop.name: Tailor
tailorshop.description: Unlock the tailor, who turns flax into linen

technologisttable.name: Technologist
technologisttable.description: Unlocks the technologist, who crafts Science Bags

typeuses.berrybush: Colonists can plant these for easy food
typeuses.bloomery: Uses charcoal as fuel to smelt iron
typeuses.bricks: It's a Dutch game, after all
typeuses.bronzeanvil: A unique anvil in the shape of a block
typeuses.bronzearrow: Monsters keep leaving negative reviews. Guards like it though!
typeuses.bronzepickaxe: Use the command tool to assign a miner. He'll use a pickaxe to extract infinite ores or stones from a block!
typeuses.bronzeplate: Like most foods, use it before it turns green!
typeuses.carpetblue: When people don't deserve the red-carpet treatment
typeuses.carpetred: It doesn't matter if you spill berry juice on this carpet!
typeuses.cherryblossom: The pinkest thing in the game
typeuses.clay: I wish you could touch it
typeuses.clothing: It looks like something you can wear. You can't.
typeuses.cokes: Creating and burning this stuff is probably totally safe for your health and the environment
typeuses.copper: Does not need to be smelted. So convenient!
typeuses.coppernails: An innovative way to combine pieces of wood
typeuses.coppertools: You can't even cut bread without tools
typeuses.fineryforge: Requires cokes to create steel from wrought iron
typeuses.flax: The most beautiful flower in the game. And the only one
typeuses.flour: A colonist with an oven will bake this into bread
typeuses.furnace: Recruits a smelter. Will consume all of your ores!
typeuses.goldcoin: With a portrait of the king on one side
typeuses.goldingot: Was once used to guarantee the value of paper money
typeuses.grassrainforest: This grass does seem pretty green
typeuses.grasssavanna: The grass seems greener on the other side
typeuses.grindstone: Used to grind wheat into flour
typeuses.gunpowderpouch: Can be uesd to fire a matchlock gun
typeuses.ironblock: Don't drop it on your foot
typeuses.ironore: Mined with an iron pickaxe that's made of iron ore
typeuses.ironsword: Apparently, only useful for the scientist
typeuses.lead: Use it in your pipes and destroy your civilization with lead poisoning
typeuses.leadbullet: Can be fired by a matchlock gun
typeuses.leavestemperate: Try to jump into a pile of these from a high tower
typeuses.linen: Lingerie means underwear made of linen
typeuses.linenpouch: Can be used to store gunpowder
typeuses.logtemperate: Like an output log, but different
typeuses.matchlockgun: Requires gunpowder pouches to fire lead bullets
typeuses.mint: It's not counterfeiting if the king says it's okay
typeuses.planks: Now with 4 times the volume of logs!
typeuses.redplanks: Does not have any food value, but it tastes pretty good
typeuses.salpeter: Don't spice up your food with this
typeuses.sand: Does not mix well with snakes
typeuses.sciencebaglife: Required to research science related to health and life
typeuses.sciencebagmilitary: Required to research science related to combat
typeuses.sciencelab: Used by a Scientist to unlock new technologies. Multiple Scientists can work together!
typeuses.splittingstump: Used by a woodcutter to split wood into firewood
typeuses.straw: Needed for beds, byproduct of wheat farming
typeuses.tailorshop: Can make linen, carpet, clothing and bags
typeuses.water: You are NOT supposed to have this in your inventory!
typeuses.wheat: A colonist with a grindstone will turn this into flour
typeuses.workbench: Recruits an artisan. Will do the crafting for you!
